job_details.degree_required: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related fields.

jd: From: RAHUL BALUSA, FISEC GLOBAL rahul@fisecglobal.net Reply to: rahul@fisecglobal.net Role: Oracle EBS Configurator with JavaLocation: Atlanta, GA (Remote)--EST Candidates PreferredDuration: Long term Job description:A developer who worked on Oracle EBS Configurator with Java plays a specialized role combining both Java development skills and Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) expertise, especially focused on Oracle Configurator. Below is a typical description of the experience and responsibilities for such a role:Job Description for a Developer with Oracle EBS Configurator and JavaThis role demands expertise in both Java development and Oracle EBS configurator, ensuring smooth product configurations and integrations across various modules and systems. Key Responsibilities:1. Oracle Configurator Development:Implement and customize Oracle Configurator models.Develop and maintain rules, constraints, and functional requirements for configuring products and services within Oracle EBS.Work with Oracle Configurator Developer (OCD) to define complex models, including component structures, BOMs (Bill of Materials), and pricing strategies.2. Java-Based Customizations:Develop custom Java applications or extensions for Oracle EBS Configurator.Create and integrate Java-based solutions for product configuration management, pricing, and order fulfillment within the Oracle ecosystem.Work on the integration of Oracle Configurator with external systems using Java.3. Oracle EBS Integration:Integrate Oracle Configurator with various Oracle EBS modules like Order Management, Inventory, and BOM.Develop and maintain APIs and web services to facilitate communication between Oracle EBS and external systems.Create Java-based interfaces to enhance Oracle Configurator’s capabilities and user experience.4. Customization and Extension of Oracle Configurator:Write and maintain Java code to customize Configurator’s features, including user interfaces, back-end processes, and complex configuration logic.Extend Configurator’s functionalities to meet specific client or business needs, ensuring smooth functionality across all integrated systems.5. Technical Support and Troubleshooting:Provide troubleshooting support for Oracle Configurator issues, both in Java-based applications and EBS configurations.Debug issues, perform root cause analysis, and implement fixes for configuration models or Java code.Optimize performance of Oracle Configurator and Java applications to ensure efficient and seamless configuration experiences.6. Oracle EBS Customization:Customize Oracle EBS forms and reports to support Oracle Configurator processes.Use Oracle Forms, Reports, and OAF (Oracle Application Framework) as needed alongside Java-based solutions.7. Collaboration with Business Analysts and Functional Teams:Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and understand configuration requirements.Translate business rules into Oracle Configurator models and Java solutions.Ensure alignment between technical solutions and business needs.8. Documentation:Document customization and configuration efforts, including Java code and Oracle Configurator models.Maintain clear technical documentation for future enhancements or troubleshooting. Required Skills:Strong experience with Java, including Java-based enterprise applications and custom integrations.Hands-on experience with Oracle Configurator and Oracle EBS modules, especially Order Management, BOM, Inventory, and Manufacturing.Experience with Oracle Configurator Developer (OCD).Proficiency in SQL, PL/SQL, and Oracle Database.Experience with Oracle Forms/Reports and Oracle Application Framework (OAF) is a plus.Knowledge of XML, SOAP/REST web services, and integrating Oracle EBS with third-party applications.Problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot both Java-based and Oracle EBS-related issues.Strong communication skills to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Educational Requirements:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related fields.Oracle certifications (Oracle EBS or Configurator-related) are a plus.
